subject: Economics
title: Mobile Money: Banking Without Banks
description: A fast breakdown of Mobile Money: Banking Without Banks for builders.

hook.text: In Kenya, more people use M-Pesa mobile money than have bank accounts. A phone replaced the entire banking system.

buildup.text: M-Pesa launched in 2007. Users deposit cash at local agents and transfer money via text message. No bank needed.

discovery.text: By 2023, M-Pesa processed $314 billion annually. It lifted 2% of Kenyan households out of extreme poverty.

twist.text: Traditional banks tried to block M-Pesa. Kenya's central bank protected it.

climax.text: Mobile money proved that financial inclusion doesn't need banks â€” it needs phones and local trust networks.

punchline.text: Africa's banking revolution runs on text messages.

quiz.question: What made M-Pesa revolutionary in Kenya?
options: It provided banking services via mobile phone without requiring a bank account
